meanings.definition: A trick or device intended to attract attention or increase appeal.
meanings.sent1: The magician used a gimmick to make the coin disappear.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement relied on a gimmick to draw in customers.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly gimmick made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her gimmick of wearing mismatched socks was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights and catchy music were all part of the gimmick to sell the product.

meanings.definition: A clever or novel idea or device.
meanings.sent1: The new phone has a gimmick that allows it to take photos underwater.
meanings.sent2: The author's gimmick of writing the story backward intrigued readers.
meanings.sent3: The chef's gimmick of serving dessert first surprised the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her gimmick of using emojis instead of words was both fun and creative.
meanings.sent5: The artist's gimmick of painting with her feet amazed the audience.
